intro: Pentas leucaster, commonly known as white pentas, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces five-petaled blooms that are typically arranged in dense, showy inflorescences. It thrives in warm, sunny climates and prefers well-drained soil. Pentas leucaster is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
